key.name: net-double-click-time
key.summary: Maximum time allowed between two clicks for them to be considered a double click (in milliseconds).

key.name: net-double-click-distance
key.summary: Maximum distance allowed between two clicks for them to be considered a double click (in pixels).

key.name: net-dnd-drag-threshold
key.summary: Number of pixels the cursor can move before dragging.

key.name: net-cursor-blink
key.summary: Whether the cursor should blink.

key.name: net-cursor-blink-time
key.summary: Length of the cursor blink cycle, in milleseconds.

key.name: net-theme-name
key.summary: Name of theme to use. This is a directory either in ~/.themes (except on Debian), or the 'system' theme directory, which depends on where GTK was installed. Basically, it could be anywhere. This should really use the base dir spec or something similar to locate the theme.

key.name: net-icon-theme-name
key.summary: Name of icon theme to use for icons.

key.name: net-enable-event-sounds
key.summary: Sounds for events
key.description: Whether to play sounds on user events.

key.name: net-sound-theme-name
key.summary: Sound theme name
key.description: The XDG sound theme to use for event sounds.

key.name: net-enable-input-feedback-sounds
key.summary: Input feedback sounds
key.description: Whether to play sounds on input events.

key.name: xft-antialias
key.summary: Whether to antialias Xft fonts; 0=no, 1=yes, -1=default.

key.name: xft-hinting
key.summary: Whether to hint Xft fonts; 0=no, 1=yes, -1=default.

key.name: xft-hint-style
key.summary: What degree of hinting to use; "hintnone", "hintslight", "hintmedium", or "hintfull".

key.name: xft-rgba
key.summary: Type of subpixel antialiasing; "none", "rgb", "bgr", "vrgb", "vbgr".

key.name: xft-dpi
key.summary: Resolution for Xft, in 1024 * dots/inch. -1 to use default value. Do not modify it manually.

key.name: gtk-cursor-theme-name
key.summary: Name of the cursor theme.

key.name: gtk-cursor-theme-size
key.summary: Size of the cursor referenced by cursor_theme.

key.name: gtk-font-name
key.summary: Name of default font to use.

key.name: gtk-key-theme-name
key.summary: Name of key theme RC file to load.

key.name: gtk-toolbar-style
key.summary: Whether default toolbars have text only, text and icons, icons only, etc.

key.name: gtk-toolbar-icons-size
key.summary: Size of icons in default toolbars.

key.name: gtk-im-preedit-style
key.summary: How to draw the input method preedit string.

key.name: gtk-im-status-style
key.summary: How to draw the input method statusbar.

key.name: gtk-im-module
key.summary: Name of the input method module used by GTK+.

key.name: gtk-menu-images
key.summary: Whether images should be shown in menus.

key.name: gtk-button-images
key.summary: Whether stock icons should be shown in buttons.

key.name: gtk-menubar-accel
key.summary: The accelerator for moving the focus to the menubar.

key.name: gtk-color-scheme
key.summary: List of symbolic names and color equivalents
key.description: A '\n' separated list of "name:color" as defined by the 'gtk-color-scheme' setting

key.name: gtk-file-chooser-backend
key.summary: Module to use as the filesystem model for the GtkFileChooser widget. Possible values are "gio" and "gtk+".

key.name: gtk-decoration-layout
key.summary: Titlebar layout of GTK3 client-side decorated windows
key.description: This setting determines which buttons should be put in the titlebar of client-side decorated windows, and whether they should be placed at the left of right. See https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/GtkSettings.html#GtkSettings--gtk-decoration-layout.

key.name: gtk-shell-shows-app-menu
key.summary: Use a global menubar for displaying application menus
key.description: This setting determines where application menu will be displayed - in a window or on a panel with MenuModel protocol. See https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/GtkSettings.html#GtkSettings--gtk-shell-shows-app-menu.

key.name: gtk-shell-shows-menubar
key.summary: Use a global menubar for displaying window menubars
key.description: This setting determines where window menubars will be displayed - in a window or on a panel with MenuModel protocol. See https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/GtkSettings.html#GtkSettings--gtk-shell-shows-menubar.

key.name: gtk-show-input-method-menu
key.summary: Show the 'Input Methods' menu
key.description: Whether the context menus of entries and text views should offer to change the input method.

key.name: gtk-show-unicode-menu
key.summary: Show the 'Unicode Control Character' menu
key.description: Whether the context menus of entries and text views should offer to insert control characters.

key.name: gtk-automatic-mnemonics
key.summary: Only show mnemonics on when the Alt key is pressed
key.description: Whether mnemonics should be automatically shown and hidden when the user presses the Alt key.

key.name: gtk-enable-primary-paste
key.summary: Enable the primary paste selection
key.description: If true, gtk+ uses the primary paste selection, usually triggered by a middle mouse button click.

key.name: gtk-enable-animations
key.summary: Enable Gtk toolkit-wide animations

key.name: gtk-dialogs-use-header
key.summary: Use GTK3 header bar
key.description: Whether builtin GTK+ dialogs such as the file chooser, the color chooser or the font chooser will use a header bar at the top to show action widgets, or an action area at the bottom. This setting does not affect custom dialogs using GtkDialog directly, or message dialogs.

key.name: window-scaling-factor
key.summary: Window Scaling Factor
key.description: This controls the GTK scale factor that maps from window coordinates to the actual device pixels. On traditional systems this is 1, but on very high density displays (e.g. HiDPI, Retina) this can be a higher value (often 2). Set to 0 to auto-detect.

key.name: window-scaling-factor-qt-sync
key.summary: Scaling Factor for QT appllications
key.description: This setting determines whether MATE controls the scale factor for QT applications. Enable to synchronize with the GTK scale factor when initializing the session, disable to control this value elsewhere. Requires restarting your session.
